info.official_title: A Two-part Phase I Study With the Antibody-drug Conjugate SYD985 in Combination With Niraparib to Evaluate Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy in Patients With HER2-expressing Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors.

identified_line.line: * Patient with a histologically-confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic tumour who has progressed on standard therapy or for whom no standard therapy exists, with the following restriction:

criterions.exact_snippets: histologically-confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic tumour
histologically-confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic tumour
progressed on standard therapy
for whom no standard therapy exists

and_criteria.exact_snippets: histologically-confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic tumour
histologically-confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic tumour

or_criteria.exact_snippets: progressed on standard therapy
for whom no standard therapy exists

identified_line.line: * Part 1: solid tumours of any origin;

criterions.exact_snippets: solid tumours of any origin

and_criteria.exact_snippets: solid tumours of any origin

identified_line.line: * Part 2: breast cancer, ovarian cancer or endometrial carcinoma/carcinosarcoma;

ovarian cancer
endometrial carcinoma/carcinosarcoma

or_criteria.exact_snippets: breast cancer
ovarian cancer
endometrial carcinoma/carcinosarcoma

identified_line.line: * HER2 tumor status at least 1+ as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC) as determined by the local laboratory;

identified_line.line: * Presence of a tumor lesion accessible for biopsy and patient should be willing to undergo a fresh biopsy for central HER2 testing and genetic testing, unless adequate (biopsy) tumour material is available obtained < 6 months prior to signing the main informed consent;

identified_line.line: * At least one measurable cancer lesion as defined by the Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumours (RECIST version 1.1);

criterions.exact_snippets: At least one measurable cancer lesion

and_criteria.exact_snippets: At least one measurable cancer lesion

identified_line.line: * Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status ≤ 1;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

identified_line.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

identified_line.line: * Having been treated with:

identified_line.line: 1. DUBA-containing ADCs at any time;

criterions.exact_snippets: DUBA-containing ADCs at any time

identified_line.line: 2. Anthracycline treatment within 8 weeks prior to start of study treatment;

criterions.exact_snippets: Anthracycline treatment within 8 weeks prior to start of study treatment

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Anthracycline treatment within 8 weeks prior to start of study treatment

identified_line.line: 4. Radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to start of study treatment or within 1 week for palliative care (as long as the lungs were not exposed);

criterions.exact_snippets: Radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to start of study treatment
Radiotherapy ... within 1 week for palliative care (as long as the lungs were not exposed)
Radiotherapy ... within 1 week for palliative care (as long as the lungs were not exposed)

identified_line.line: 5. Hormone therapy within 1 week prior to start of study treatment. The patient must have sufficiently recovered from any treatment-related toxicities to NCI CTCAE Grade ≤ 1 (except for toxicities not considered a safety risk for the patient at the investigator's discretion);

criterions.exact_snippets: Hormone therapy within 1 week prior to start of study treatment
sufficiently recovered from any treatment-related toxicities to NCI CTCAE Grade ≤ 1

identified_line.line: * Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50% as assessed by either echocardiography or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan at screening, or a history of clinically significant decrease in LVEF during previous trastuzumab containing treatment leading to permanent discontinuation of treatment;

history of clinically significant decrease in LVEF during previous trastuzumab containing treatment leading to permanent discontinuation of treatment
